title: tour: [confusing explanation]
body:
Context: https://tour.golang.org/basics/14

For Type inference, the explanation reads "When declaring a variable without specifying its type (using var without a type or the := syntax), the variable's type is inferred from the value on the right hand side."

This is confusing because you cannot actually use var without a type.
When you declare a variable using "var" you must specify a type, either explicitly like "var x int" or implicitly through an initial assignment like "var x = 5" but you cannot define it like "var x" (without a type) as the explanation reads.
